area_name: Huck's Fins aka Sun Dial Crag (submitted as Fin Land)

content.description: If you avoid cheating (using the chimney on the left), this is a continuously vertical climb with diminishing rewards.  The third bolt is hard to clip from the chimney, but you must get it if you want protection.  Beware of a perched loose block in the upper section of chimney, but it's easy to avoid.  Using the chimney may make the climb 5.9ish.  If not using it, expect at least 5.12.  The rock quality is poorer here than on the other routes.
content.location: This 20-foot phallus is located east and downhill from the other routes.

content.description: Mike Endicott couldn't do it without lots of hangs, so it is at least 5.12.  I didn't try.
content.protection: Two or three bolts to two Fixe rings.
content.location: It is on the west face of the leftmost fin.

content.description: Work up from the base on the lower left.  Place a medium cam in a horizontal and keep moving, clipping two bolts.  Keep moving past the second bolt (committing) as strength is ebbing.
content.protection: Medium cam, two bolts; two-bolt anchor.
content.location: This is on the narrow south face of the leftmost fin.

content.description: Scramble over chockstone (optional long sling).  Move up and clip the first of four bolts.  Encounter the edgy crux, with possible ankle-damaging ledgefall before clipping the second bolt.  This has fun edging to the anchors.
content.protection: Four bolts; optional long sling for low chockstone; bolted anchors.
content.location:
This is on the southwest-facing slab, right of

Ear Rings

.

content.description:
From right side of staging area, climb over bulge while avoiding loose blocks or flakes.  Move up to nice, short hand crack.  Sling a cammed chock-flake if you don't have cams.  Continue up a short hand crack, then walk off.  You may, instead, take the left, vegetated crack to the anchors atop

Edgy

.
content.protection:
Hand-size cams, optional long sling for cammed chock-flake, and optional bolted anchors atop

Edgy

.

content.description: Scramble over a chockstone, which could be slung, stand up and clip the first bolt on the left edge of the east face.  Make committing moves up, and clip the second bolt. Above the third bolt, make strange moves up to a sloping shelf.  Clip a pair of rings on the southeast ear.
content.protection: Three bolts; optional long sling around chockstone; two Fixe anchors.
content.location: It is on the left edge of east face of middle fin (which has two ears on top).

pathTokens: Huck's Fins aka Sun Dial Crag (submitted as Fin Land)
